Intro to Eleventy

Installation

Lazy and/or Fast

npx @11ty/eleventy

Safer

npm i --save @11ty/eleventy

{
  "scripts": {
    "build": "@11ty/eleventy",
    "start": "@11ty/eleventy --serve"
  }
}

Install Globally?

npm i -g @11ty/eleventy

Depends on your opinions about global modules, and how you manage node versions.

¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

Eleventy Config

  • .eleventy.js
  • Optional, if you don‚Äôt need to change defaults
module.exports = eleventyConfig => {
  return {
    templateFormats: [],
    dir: {}
  };
};

Setting Up Content

Markdown Files

---
title: My Page Title
author: My Name
permalink: /this-page-url/
layout: post
date: 10-19-2020
tags:
  - news
---
Markdown content here.

Content from an API

// _data/posts.js
module.exports = () => {
  return new Promise(() => {
    // Make a request
    // `resolve` the returned data
  });
};

Content from an API

{% for p in posts %}
  {{ p.content }}
{% endfor %}

Content from an API

<!-- posts.md -->
---
permalink: p.permalink
pagination:
  data: posts
  size: 1
  alias: p
---

Templating

Layouts

---
layout: home
---

This page will be rendered with _includes/home.liquid.

  • Or other template extension, e.g. home.njk

Layouts Directory

Default: dir.includes (default: _includes)

Override in .eleventy.js

dir: {
  layouts: 'templates'
}

Nesting Templates

index.md -->
---
layout: home
---

home.liquid -->
---
layout: global
---

Layout Aliases

Custom layout names mapped to files/folders

module.exports = eleventyConfig => {
  eleventyConfig.addLayoutAlias(
    'home',
    'views/homeTemplate.njk'
  );
};

Partials (Components)

{% include header %}

maps to

_includes/header.liquid

Eleventy Defaults

Directories

11ty dir key Folder
input .
output _site
includes _includes
layouts dir.includes
data _data

Permalinks

  • Front matter permalink value.
  • Fallback: filename (minus extension) becomes path
    • contact.md becomes /contact/index.html

Templating

  • Default: Liquid
  • Included alternatives:
    • ejs, hbs, mustache, haml, pug, njk
